title: Luxury Glenhaven home with underground squash court, rainforest, hits the market
text:
The original owners of this Glenhaven property spent $1 million on landscaping their home at a time when the average Sydney house price just $50,000.

Now, 40 years later, it has grown into a magnificent estate with its own rainforest, dam and even an underground squash court.

MORE: Landmark Point Piper home could fetch $60m

Boom is back for Sydney property prices

The property at 19 Wayfield Rd has just been listed for sale and is expected to fetch around $5 million.

It also features beautiful sandstone retaining walls, pergolas, rolling lawns and blossoming flower beds.

“This garden doesn’t have your everyday run-of-the-mill hedging — it has established trees and gardens with just beautiful colours,” said agent William Brush from LJ Hooker Dural.

“There is substantial stonework you wouldn’t do today because of the cost — they have not been packed with mortar but instead have been cut into perfect shape so they all fit together. There would be 100m plus of it around the property.”

The grounds surrounding the sprawling six-bedroom residence are maintained by two gardeners who work several days a week.

The home itself offers both formal and informal living plus a rumpus/games room with wet bar and a wine cellar.

It opens up to a resort-style swimming pool that overlooks the picturesque botanical-like gardens. A surprise feature is a squash court located in an excavated area underneath the flood lit tennis court. In addition there is a sauna, spa and a gym.

It is the second time the home has been listed for sale since the garden was planted.

“People think the house is definitely a one off — I think I have only seen one or two properties in the Hills that have gardens that you could even compare to these,” Mr Brush said.
description: This incredible Sydney estate with its own rainforest and underground squash court has hit the market with eye-catching expectations.
